  • havoc.autoval.lib.test_utils.mprime_runner

Source code for havoc.autoval.lib.test_utils.mprime_runner

from havoc.autoval.lib.test_utils.test_utils_base import TestUtilsBase
from havoc.autotest_testfiles.validation_utils.lib.autoval_thread import AutovalThread
from havoc.autotest_testfiles.validation_utils.lib.autoval_exceptions import (
    TimeoutError
)
from havoc.autotest_testfiles.validation_utils.lib.generic_utils import GenericUtils
from havoc.autotest_testfiles.validation_utils.lib.site_utils import SiteUtils
from havoc.autotest_testfiles.validation_utils.lib.autoval import AutovalUtils



[docs]class MprimeRunner(TestUtilsBase):

[docs]    def __init__(self, host, args):
        super(MprimeRunner, self).__init__()
        self.host = host
        self.DEFAULT_ARGS = {
            "runtime" : None,
            "no_of_instance" : 1
        }
        self.user_args = args



[docs]    def test_setup(self):
        self.generate_args(self.user_args)
        self.tooldir = SiteUtils().get_tool_path()
        self.tmpdir = SiteUtils().get_tmpdir()



[docs]    def generate_args(self, args):
        """
        Merges default and user provided args

        @param args: a dictionary of arguments provided by user
        @return: returns a dictionary of the updated arguments
        """
        merged_args = self.DEFAULT_ARGS.copy()
        merged_args.update(args)
        self.user_args.update(merged_args)



[docs]    def start_test(self):
        tarball = "/mprime.tar.gz"
        tarball = GenericUtils.extract(self.tooldir + tarball, self.tmpdir)

        try:
            queue_list = []
            # start a number of mprime threads concurrently
            for _ in range(self.user_args["no_of_instance"]):
                queue_list.append(
                    AutovalThread.start_autoval_thread(
                        self.spawn_mprime()
                    )
                )
            # wait for threads to finish before concluding test
            AutovalThread.wait_for_autoval_thread(queue_list)
        except TimeoutError as e:
            """
            mprime does not have a timeout option and will run indefinitely.
            Killing mprime might add a few seconds to the test duration, which can cause
            havoc to fail it. Timeout error can be ignored.
            """
            AutovalUtils.log_info("Ignoring Timeout Error -  %s" % str(e))
            pass



[docs]    def spawn_mprime(self):
        """
        Create an instance of mprime
        """
        # enable torture mode
        _opts = "-t 3"
        dirr = self.tmpdir + "/mprime"
        self.host.run("./mprime " + _opts, timeout=self.user_args["runtime"],
            working_directory=dirr)



[docs]    def parse_results(self):
        pass
